title: Show provided photo after YES click and update displayed name

requirements.text: Update the proposal question text in the initial stage to display the name exactly as: "Suzanne The Nazareth" (replacing "Miss Nazareth").

quotes: Put the name as "Suzanne The Nazareth" instead of Miss Nazareth

acceptanceCriteria: On the initial screen, the headline reads exactly: "Will you be my Valentine, Suzanne The Nazareth?"
No other visible UI text still says "Miss Nazareth"

requirements.text: After the user clicks YES, show the provided uploaded image (aman_suz_pic.jpeg) as the final photo in the YES flow without requiring the user to upload a photo.

quotes: put this picture after Yes is clicked

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking YES triggers the existing celebration/meme stage, then transitions to the final stage showing aman_suz_pic.jpeg.
The final stage displays the photo reliably on refresh/reload (i.e., it is served as a static asset, not dependent on runtime local upload).
The YES flow still works on mobile (iPhone/Android Chrome) without layout overflow or scroll issues.

requirements.text: Add the uploaded image file aman_suz_pic.jpeg to the frontend static assets and reference it from the final stage UI.

quotes: put this picture after Yes is clicked

acceptanceCriteria: The repository includes the image in a publicly served frontend path (e.g., under frontend/public) and the app references it via a stable /assets/... URL.
The image renders in the final stage with the existing final image styling (frame/border) and fits responsively.

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui or any other frontend immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Keep the backend as-is (no new Motoko methods/state) unless strictly required for this UI-only change.
nonGoals: Adding Internet Identity login or any new authentication features.
Changing the meme image or confetti/sound behavior beyond what is necessary to show the provided photo after YES.
